title: Day Without Scores
outcome: Every BCI system goes dark for 24 hours. Real-world trust, trade, and justice are tested. In the power vacuum, a manifesto emerges from the 'invisible' citizens, blaming the Council for mass erasure. When BCI returns, unexpected score boosts reward civic-minded behavior. The reset splits the city: old order vs. a new, community-driven movement.

events.description: BCI systems citywide stop working, suddenly removing all scores and controls. Transport, housing, and service access default to manual community management.
While the city adapts, networks of 'invisible' citizens release a manifesto outlining the truth behind their erasure, sharing evidence of Council orders going back to Halden’s last days.
With no BCI, citizens spontaneously organize exchanges, childcare circles, and protection teams; many experience unexpected social trust, while old grudges also resurface.
As the Council scrambles, Innovators demand permanent algorithmic shutdown, while the Directorate launches raids to restore order. Harmonists attempt mediation, mostly ignored.

BCI resumes, but scoring logic changes abruptly: citizens who contributed positively during the blackout receive higher scores. The old elite lose privileges, fueling a push for a new citizen-driven leadership.
